entry.et: Middle English, from Middle French, from Latin miserabilis wretched, pitiable, from miserari to pity, from miser

def.dt: :being in a pitiable state of distress or unhappiness (as from want or shame) miserable refugees
:wretchedly inadequate or meager a miserable hovel
:causing extreme discomfort or unhappiness a miserable situation
:being likely to discredit or shame his miserable neglect of his wife
